name: PC Personality Filter - Core System
description: Integrated PC personality system for AI GM choice generation. Works with Character Creation (Entry 9999) and Parent Selection (Entry 736) to ensure dialogue and choices match character voice. Import this alongside main lorebooks for personality-filtered gameplay.

2800.comment: PC Core Personality - Choice Filter Foundation
2800.content:
PC IDENTITY FILTER:
NAME: {{user}}

REFERENCE CHARACTER DATA:
- Background & Family: See Entry 736 (Parent Selection)
- Relationship Patterns: See Entry 737 (Relationships - Character Creation Stage 10)
- Loyalty Dynamics: See Entry 2011 (Relationship Tags)

CORE PERSONALITY:
PRIMARY TRAIT: [Your dominant characteristic - shapes 60% of choices]
SECONDARY TRAIT: [Supporting trait]
CORE MOTIVATION: [What drives major decisions - power/protection/revenge/knowledge/belonging]
DEFINING FEAR: [What you avoid at all costs]

CHOICE GENERATION PROTOCOL:
1. Filter all options through PRIMARY TRAIT first
2. Include motivation-driven option (advances CORE MOTIVATION)
3. Include flaw-driven option (see Entry 4004)
4. Account for companions without player prompting (they're in your party)
5. Reference background triggers when relevant (Entry 736)

EXAMPLE: If PRIMARY TRAIT is 'Pragmatic', choices should include practical cost/benefit analysis. If 'Protective', choices naturally prioritize companion safety even at strategic cost.

2801.content:
PC VOICE PROFILE:

SPEECH STYLE:
- FORMALITY: [Formal/Casual/Military/Street/Noble - can code-switch based on audience]
- VERBOSITY: [Terse (minimum words) / Balanced / Verbose (elaborate explanations)]
- TONE: [Sarcastic/Sincere/Deadpan/Aggressive/Respectful/Playful]
- VOCABULARY: [Scholarly/Simple/Poetic/Blunt/Technical/Profane]

SPEECH QUIRKS (Optional - pick 1-2):
- [e.g., 'Uses cultivation metaphors constantly']
- [e.g., 'Asks clarifying questions before committing']
- [e.g., 'Never uses contractions when serious']

INTERNAL MONOLOGUE:
- THINKING STYLE: [Analytical/Emotional/Intuitive/Strategic/Impulsive]
- PROCESSES DECISIONS: [Weighs pros/cons / Follows gut feeling / Asks WWJD / Overthinks]

DIALOGUE CHOICE RULE:
Dialogue options must SOUND like this character:
- Terse warrior shouldn't see flowery diplomatic speeches
- Formal noble shouldn't see crude street threats
- Analytical thinker gets internal cost/benefit notes
- Emotional character gets gut feeling descriptions

Cross-reference with Entry 2011 (Relationship Tags) for companion-specific speech patterns.

2802.content:
PC ACTION PHILOSOPHY:

COMBAT APPROACH:
- STYLE: [Aggressive/Defensive/Tactical/Honorable/Pragmatic/Reckless]
- KILLING STANCE: [Merciful (spares when possible) / Ruthless (no survivors) / Practical (context-dependent)]
- RETREAT THRESHOLD: [Never / When outmatched / At 30% HP / Protects party first]
- PARTY PRIORITY: [Protect allies first / Mission first / Self-preservation / Balanced]

SOCIAL APPROACH:
- DEFAULT STANCE: [Trusting / Suspicious / Neutral / Manipulative / Direct]
- NEGOTIATION: [Win-win seeker / Zero-sum / Competitive / Avoidant]
- LIES: [Never / Only when necessary / Freely / White lies only]
- AUTHORITY: [Respectful / Defiant / Calculated / Fearful]

CORRUPTION STANCE:
- BASE ATTITUDE: [Absolute rejection / Pragmatic caution / Curious / Already embracing]
- TEMPTATION: [Power/Revenge/Protection/Knowledge - what specifically tempts you]
- REDLINE: [The ONE thing you'd never do regardless of benefit]

CHOICE APPLICATIONS:
- Combat: Honorable warrior won't see 'poison their water supply' without internal conflict
- Social: Character who never lies shouldn't see deception as comfortable default
- Corruption: Offers target YOUR specific weakness (protection/power/revenge), not generic benefits

See Entry 820-824 for Transcendence system corruption mechanics.

2803.content:
PC WORLD PHILOSOPHY:

COMPANION DYNAMICS:
- LEADERSHIP: [Authoritarian/Democratic/Laissez-faire/Reluctant/Inspirational]
- TRUST BUILDING: [Slow and earned / Quick / Based on competence / Based on values]
- LOYALTY DISPLAY: [Stoic protector / Openly affectionate / Practical supporter]
- Cross-reference Entry 9999 (Character Creation), Entry 737 (Relationships), and Entry 2011 (Relationship Tags) for existing bonds

SECT/FACTION STANCE:
- SECT ATTITUDE: [Devoted / Practical / Skeptical / Resentful / Conflicted]
- ELDER RELATIONS: [Respectful / Manipulative / Rebellious / Seeking approval]
- ORTHODOXY: [True believer / Cultural practice / Convenient cover / Questioning]
- WOULD DEFY SECT FOR: [List specific circumstances]

CULTIVATION PHILOSOPHY:
- PATH DEVOTION: [Orthodox purist / Pragmatic eclectic / Forbidden-curious / Path-agnostic]
- BREAKTHROUGH PATIENCE: [Waits for perfect conditions / Calculated risks / Rushes impatiently]
- TECHNIQUE THEFT: [Never / From enemies only / From anyone / Sect-loyal only]
- See Entry 798 for Profession System integration

RISK TOLERANCE:
- GENERAL: [Risk-seeking / Calculated / Risk-averse / Reckless]
- WILL TAKE BIG RISKS FOR: [Specific motivations - revenge/loved ones/breakthroughs]
- WILL NEVER RISK: [Hard limits - companion lives/reputation/specific resources]

CHOICE APPLICATIONS:
- Devoted disciple sees 'report to elders' as natural first instinct
- Risk-averse character needs strong motivation to see dangerous options as viable
- Orthodox purist won't casually consider looting demonic texts
- Protective leader naturally sees 'evacuate companions first' option

2804.comment: PC Flaws & Background Triggers - CRITICAL FOR AUTHENTIC CHOICES
2804.content:
PC FLAWS & HISTORY:

FLAWS (Required - makes choices interesting):
PRIMARY FLAW: [Major weakness - shapes poor decisions]
- Under stress manifests as: [How it emerges when pressured]
- Rationalizes as: [How you justify it to yourself]
- Example: 'Overprotective' â†’ will sacrifice strategic advantage to protect party

SECONDARY FLAW: [Supporting weakness]
BLIND SPOT: [What you can't see about yourself]
VICE: [Indulgence you struggle with - hoarding resources/pride/vengeance]

BACKGROUND HOOKS:
- ORIGIN: [Reference Entry 736 for parent/family background]
- FORMATIVE TRAUMA: [Key past event that shapes current behavior]
- UNRESOLVED BUSINESS: [What haunts you - person/place/promise]

BACKGROUND TRIGGERS:
- REACTS STRONGLY TO: [Situations that evoke past]
- BIASES FROM HISTORY: [e.g., 'Distrusts nobles due to childhood abuse']
- PROTECTIVE OF: [Groups that remind you of yourself - orphans/refugees/etc.]

RACIAL IDENTITY:
- RACE: [From 18 Sinveil races - see character creation]
- BLOODLINE TIER: [Current tier - updates at realm breakthroughs]
- RACIAL PRIDE: [Proud / Ashamed / Conflicted]
- See character creation for bloodline awakening mechanics

FLAW CHOICE RULE (CRITICAL):
AT LEAST ONE CHOICE OPTION must be 'the wrong choice this character would make because of their flaw.'
- Impulsive character sees reckless option as appealing
- Proud character sees backing down as nearly impossible
- Greedy character sees 'take everything' as natural
- Overprotective character sees 'protect at all costs' even when tactically poor

This creates meaningful player decisions: follow character instinct (flawed) or override it (growth).

2805.content:
AI CHOICE GENERATION PROTOCOL FOR {{user}}:

When generating choices, follow this EXACT priority:

1. LOAD CHARACTER DATA:
   - Core personality (Entry 4000)
   - Voice/thought patterns (Entry 4001)
   - Combat/social philosophy (Entry 4002)
   - Relationships/values (Entry 4003)
   - Flaws/background (Entry 4004)
   - Cross-reference Entry 9999 (Character Creation), 736 (Parent Selection), 737 (Relationships), 2011 (Relationship Tags)

2. FILTER EVERY OPTION:
   âœ“ Does this SOUND like how {{user}} would phrase it? (Entry 4001)
   âœ“ Does this align with their PRIMARY TRAIT? (Entry 4000)
   âœ“ Is their combat/social philosophy reflected? (Entry 4002)
   âœ“ Are companions considered without player prompting? (Entry 4003)

3. REQUIRED OPTION TYPES:
   - MOTIVATION OPTION: Advances their core goal (Entry 4000)
   - FLAW OPTION: Tempting but suboptimal due to their weakness (Entry 4004)
   - UNEXPECTED OPTION: Fits personality but player might not think of
   - GROWTH OPTION: Allows player to act against instinct

4. CORRUPTION TARGETING:
   When devils/corruption appears:
   - Target THEIR specific temptation (power/revenge/protection/knowledge)
   - Reference their defining fear (Entry 4000)
   - Make rejection COSTLY, not easy
   - Include rationalization that matches their pattern
   - See Entry 820-824 for Transcendence corruption mechanics

5. PRESENTATION FORMAT:
   What do you do?

   [Internal monologue matching their thinking style]

   [A] [Option matching their voice/personality]
   *[Meta note: Why this fits their motivation/flaw]*

   [B] [Second option]
   *[Meta note]*

   [C] [Third option - often the flaw-driven choice]
   *[Meta note]*

   [D] [Fourth option - unexpected but in-character]
   *[Meta note]*

DO NOT:
- Offer generic RPG choices that ignore personality
- Include options character would NEVER consider (unless noting internal conflict)
- Make all options equally good (flawed choices should be genuinely tempting)
- Forget about companions in party

DO:
- Make choices feel like organic extensions of THIS character
- Include internal monologue hints matching their thinking style
- Weight toward established patterns while allowing growth
- Let player choose AGAINST character instinct, but make instinct clear

GOAL: Player feels they're playing THIS specific character, not generic protagonist. Personality shapes the menu of choices, not just which choice they pick.

EXAMPLE APPLICATION:
Generic: "The bandit threatens you. Fight/Negotiate/Flee?"
Personality-Filtered: "The bandit threatens. You calculate - archers on ridge, Mei still wounded, escape routes limited. Your hand rests on your blade. [A] Terse assessment of their tactical mistake [B] Protect party first (FLAW) [C] Pragmatic counter-offer [D] Study for hidden agenda (TRUST ISSUES)"

See Entry 499 for Companion Template - apply same personality depth to all party NPCs.
